one_liner: The paper discusses the interplay between macro and individual influences on mental health, emphasizing the role of workplace policies and socioeconomic status.
bullets: Workplace policies significantly affect mental health engagement.
Individual beliefs about mental health can hinder the use of available benefits.
Socioeconomic status influences access to mental health care and perceptions of its importance.
Health disparities arise from the interaction of beliefs, policies, and economic resources.
The Health Belief Model can guide the design of digital health interventions.
Digital tools can lower barriers to mental health support and improve accessibility.
